Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery kernos with part of one vessel holder, one protome and one foot; white slip (mostly worn); interior and underside reserved; exterior, strokes across body between objects, otherwise reserved; interior of vessel glazed; four lines on outside of body, three on foot, which is grooved as a triglyph and has everted toe.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.154.d and Oxford AN1925.608e(2).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 249, no. 356)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2178) (phase 2)
